title: Everyone is taking thunderlords.
body: I feel left out with my warlords bloodlust

replies.body:
To be fair its because its the burst damage mastery.

Some of the other masteries are sleeper op though, take deathfire touch on talon, youd think it sucks, but his 6 second bleed with 130% ad ratio brings the deathfire touch damage up to a whopping 90% ad total, which makes his total bleed damage 220% ad, which with the initial hit damage is 250% ad, then thanks to the cooldown being 4 seconds if a target actually lives long enough he can actually reset the bleed and keep it going.

Imagine getting smacked in the face by a 400ad talon and then crying as you realise you now have an 880 damage bleed ticking away, and he still has the rest of his kit to hit you with. not to mention that damage is increased by his passives and other masteries so its probably closer to 2k damage in one button including the initial hit, since its 400 damage + the bonus damage so 270 + the 880 bleed, which brings it upto 1550 damage before factoring in any damage increases or resistances.

One button and the right items can do a dps of 260 and can maintain said dps easily thanks to the 6 second bleed and the 4 second cooldown.

That my friends is far more damage than your thunderlords.

Don't worry, if you're taking it on a critical strike heavy ADC, you're making the better choice. Thunderlord's isn't as strong as it used to be, it's more for assassins and mages now, as it should be.
i feel sorry for those people under level 18 who keep getting matched against people with a keystone
Personally im just getting sick of seeing 5 man teams with thunderlords, and sometimes if you don't have thunderlords your team complains about you making them weaker
